DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Biospecimen Collection Method Surgical Procedure Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of surgical procedure performed to obtain a tumor sample from a subject for testing, diagnostic, treatment, or research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._A method or procedure by which biological material is obtained from a subject for testing, diagnostic, treatment, or research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method or procedure by which biological material is obtained from a subject for testing, diagnostic, treatment, or research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A method or procedure by which biological material is obtained from a subject for testing, diagnostic, treatment, or research purposes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 8/27/20 jk added CPTAC solid tumor procurement CSI.  8/11/20 jk created for CPTAC tumor procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic or robotic-assisted cytoreductive surgery performed after primary cytoreduction and between courses of chemotherapy.

Concepts.definition: Endoscopic or robotic-assisted cytoreductive surgery performed after primary cytoreduction and between courses of chemotherapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Traditional surgery using a long incision for visualization and for the insertion of instruments.

Concepts.definition: Traditional surgery using a long incision for visualization and for the insertion of instruments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical technique that uses a specially designed robotic system to aid with the surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: A surgical technique that uses a specially designed robotic system to aid with the surgical procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/27/20 jk added TURBT ( C116651) for tumor procurement CRF; removed baseline CRF CSIs, added procurement CSI. Revised PVs to match procurement question. 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda).  11/20/19 jk created for CPTAC baseline CRFs.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released, upd Reg Status per SME (NGM) review and approval. 9/9/20 New CDE to incorporate TURBT PV and move from Baseline to Procurement CRFs; replaces CDE 7063063.
